title.narrative: COMPLETION OF A FULL CYCLE OF COMPULSORY INCLUSIVE EDUCATION FOR ALL CHILDREN

description.narrative: By 2022, adolescents and youth increased skills and competencies to be adequately prepared for adult life as active citizens and for the world of work., which contributes to Access To Quality Learning Opportunities, Access To Quality Learning Opportunities (Covid), Learning, Skills, Participation And Engagement, Learning, Skills, Participation And Engagement (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Communications, Advocacy And Public Engagement, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2022, all children and adolescents in Ukraine, especially those disadvantaged and affected by the conflict, access inclusive and quality school education and early learning while enjoying opportunities for meaningful participation and civic engagement.

mailing-address.narrative: United Nations Integrated Office 1 Klovskiy Uzviz 01021 Kiev

sector.narrative: Provision of (formal and non-formal) secondary education (including in temporary learning spaces, includes general and TVET)
Provision or procurement of secondary education learning materials
System strengthening - Education management information system (does not include learning assessment system)
System strengthening - teacher development, management, and support
Technical assistance - Equitable access to quality education

related-activity.ref: 4410/A0/05/883 INCLUSIVE AND QUALITY SCHOOL EDUCATION AND EARLY LEARNING

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2022, adolescents and youth increased skills and competencies to be adequately prepared for adult life as active citizens andfor the world of work.

description.narrative: In 2021 UNICEF with education in emergency (EiE) response have reached 27,900 school and preschool age girls and boys in Non-Government Controlled Area (NGCA) and in areas along the contact line in Government Controlled Area (GCA), providing them with educational supplies, rehabilitating schools that are in most critical need, and building capacity of teachers on identified priority topics, including Life Skills Education (LSE), Conflict Sensitive Education (CSE), Disaster Risk Reduction (DRR). In August 2021, Government of Ukraine has approved the Safe Schools Declaration (SSD) Implementation Plan, translating commitment into action and supporting education in emergencies. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:23/01/2022
